newsitem.title: USA: Indiana corn condition improves from prev week.
newsitem.headline: Indiana corn condition improves from prev week.

text.p: The corn crop as of Sunday was 62 percent good to excellent, above the 54 percent in that category the previous week, according to the Indiana Agricultural Statistics Service.
Thirty percent of the crop was fair and eight percent was poor to very poor.
The soybean crop was 98 percent seeded as of Sunday and the crop was 61 percent good to excellent, 31 percent fair and eight percent poor to very poor.
Winter wheat harvest was four percent complete, up from three percent a week ago.
Winter wheat condition was 10 percent excellent, 54 percent good, 27 percent fair, seven percent poor and two percent very poor.
Topsoil moisture levels were 24 percent surplus, 74 percent adequate and two percent short. Subsoil moisture levels were 26 percent surplus, 73 percent adequate and one percent short.
Pasture conditions were nine percent excellent, 65 percent good, 22 percent fair, three percent poor and one percent very poor.
